Minute Entry for proceedings held before JUDGE ALLEN C WINSOR:Telephonic Motion Hearing held on 7/31/2020 re 4 MOTION for Preliminary Injunction - written order to follow(Court Reporter Lisa Snyder, USDC Tallahassee) (tss) (Entered: 07/31/2020)

NOTICE OF TELEPHONIC HEARING Telephonic Status Conference set for 8/24/2020 at 10:00 AM before JUDGE ALLEN C WINSOR. ALL PARTIES are directed to call the AT&T Conference Line (see below) Conference Call Information You may dial into the call up to five minutes before start time. Call in number: 877 873 8018 When prompted for an access code, enter: 6109198# If you are asked to join as the host, just ignore and wait until you are asked for a security code. When asked for a security code, enter: 7020# Say your name, when prompted. You are now in the conference call. Remember to mute your phone when you are not speaking. The Court also asks that counsel try NOT use cell phones or speaker phones during the call as the quality of the audioconnection is compromised by these devices. However, the Court also understands that under the current circumstances, a cell phone may be all that is available. Note: If you or any party, witness or attorney in this matter has a disability that requires special accommodations, such as a hearing impairment that requires a sign-language interpreter or a wheelchair restriction that requires ramp access, please contact the Clerk's Office at least one week prior to the hearing (or as soon as possible) so arrangements can be made. s/TiAnn Stark Courtroom Deputy Clerk (tss) (Entered: 07/31/2020)

ORDER REGARDING SCHEDULE. The Initial Scheduling Order imposed an October 19 deadline for the parties' Rule 26(f) report. ECF No. 31 2. None has been filed. In the meantime, though, the Plaintiffs have amended their complaint, adding new parties. Once the new parties have been served, all parties must conduct the Rule 26(f) conference the Initial Scheduling Order anticipated, and they must promptly file a Rule 26(f) report. If they have not filed the report by 11/20/2020, Plaintiff must file a status report no later than that day, indicating the status of service and of the parties' efforts to conduct the planning conference. Signed by JUDGE ALLEN C WINSOR on 10/20/20. (blb) (Entered: 10/20/2020)

NOTICE of Hearing on Motion 4 MOTION for Preliminary Injunction Motion Hearing set for 9/3/2020 at 09:00 AM in U.S. Courthouse Tallahassee before JUDGE ALLEN C WINSOR. Two days have been reserved. DOCKET ANNOTATION BY COURT: Attorney LAUREN BRITTANY EVERSOLE Re 1 COMPLAINT- Counsel is advised by this entry, in future case openings, the Civil Cover Sheet should be filed as a separate entry using the event selection "Civil Cover Sheet" which is found under "Other Filings" under "Other Documents". Further, for future case openings: Please review the procedures in the "Style Guide for Electronic Case Filing" and/or Chapter 10 of the "CM/ECF Attorney User's Guide", (both available on the clerk's website). (blb) (Entered: 07/14/2020)

ORDER SETTING TELEPHONIC HEARING signed by JUDGE ALLEN C WINSOR on 7/15/20. The court will hold a telephonic hearing on Friday, July 17, 2020. The courtroom deputy will issue a notice of hearing with call-in information and the time. The hearings purpose will be to address the procedures for resolving the 4 MOTION for Preliminary Injunction . The hearing will not be on the motions merits. (tss) (Entered: 07/15/2020)

ORDER RESCHEDULING HEARING AND GRANTING 7 JOINT MOTION signed by JUDGE ALLEN C WINSOR on 7/16/20. The clerk will reset the telephonic hearing for July 31, 2020, at 10:00 a.m. (tss) (Entered: 07/16/2020)

NOTICE of Telephonic Hearing on Motion 4 MOTION for Preliminary Injunction Telephonic Motion Hearing set for 7/31/2020 at 10:00 AM before JUDGE ALLEN C WINSOR. ORDER REGARDING PRELIMINARY INJUNCTION MOTION signed by JUDGE ALLEN C WINSOR on 7/31/20. Defendants deadline to respond to the preliminary injunction motion is 8/21/2020. Plaintiffs may file a reply no later than 8/28/2020. The preliminary injunction hearing is set for 9/3/2020 at 09:00 AM in U.S. Courthouse Tallahassee before JUDGE ALLEN C WINSOR. Two days are reserved. Defendants deadline to respond to the complaint is extended to 9/18/2020. The clerk will set a telephonic hearing for the week of August 24 to address hearing procedures and other outstanding matters. (tss) (tss). (Entered: 07/31/2020)
ORDER. It is ORDERED that the motion for leave to appear prohac vice, ECF No. 16, is GRANTED. Signed by MAGISTRATE JUDGE MARTIN A FITZPATRICK on 8/11/20. (blb) (Entered: 08/11/2020)

ORDER GRANTING LEAVE TO WITHDRAW. Nicholas Primrose's unopposed motion for leave to withdraw (ECF No. 18 ) is GRANTED. Mr. Primrose is relieved of further obligations in this case. Signed by JUDGE ALLEN C WINSOR on 8/20/20. (blb) (Entered: 08/20/2020)

ORDER REGARDING PRELIMINARY INJUNCTION HEARING. This order confirms what was decided at today's telephonic hearing. Plaintiffs' deadline to file its reply is extended to 8/31/2020. The preliminary injunction hearing, which will not include presentation of evidence, is moved to September 4, 2020, at 2:00 p.m. The clerk will distribute call-in information. Signed by JUDGE ALLEN C WINSOR on 8/24/20. Telephonic hearing set for 9/4/2020 02:00 PM before JUDGE ALLEN C WINSOR. (blb) (Entered: 08/24/2020)
